# telegraf.js

Modern Telegram Bot API framework for Node.js

[![Bot API v6.5](https://img.shields.io/badge/Bot%20API-v6.5-f36caf.svg?style=flat-square)](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api)

<h1>telegraf.js</h1>

</div>

## Introduction

Bots are special Telegram accounts designed to handle messages automatically. Users interact with bots by sending commands or messages in private or group chats. Telegraf is a library that simplifies development of Telegram bots using JavaScript or TypeScript.


## Features

- Full Telegram Bot API v6.5 support
- Excellent TypeScript typings
- Lightweight
- Compatible with various deployment environments (AWS Lambda, Firebase, Glitch, Fly.io, etc.)
- `http/https/fastify/Connect.js/express.js` compatible webhooks
- Extensible


## Example

```javascript
const { Telegraf } = require('telegraf');
const { message } = require('telegraf/filters');

const bot = new Telegraf(process.env.BOT_TOKEN);

bot.start((ctx) => ctx.reply('Welcome!'));
bot.help((ctx) => ctx.reply('Send me a sticker'));
bot.on(message('sticker'), (ctx) => ctx.reply('👍'));
bot.hears('hi', (ctx) => ctx.reply('Hey there!'));
bot.launch();


// Enable graceful stop
process.once('SIGINT', () => bot.stop('SIGINT'));
process.once('SIGTERM', () => bot.stop('SIGTERM'));
```

```javascript
const { Telegraf } = require('telegraf');

const bot = new Telegraf(process.env.BOT_TOKEN);
bot.command('oldschool', (ctx) => ctx.reply('Hello'));
bot.command('hipster', () => ctx.reply('λ'));
bot.launch();

// Enable graceful stop
process.once('SIGINT', () => bot.stop('SIGINT'));
process.once('SIGTERM', () => bot.stop('SIGTERM'));
```


## For 3.x users

- [3.x docs](https://telegraf.js.org/v3)

## Getting Started

### Telegram Token

Obtain a bot token from BotFather.

### Installation

```bash
npm install telegraf
# or
yarn add telegraf
# or
pnpm add telegraf
```

### `Telegraf` Class

The `Telegraf` instance represents your bot, handling updates and passing them to handlers.

Start by listening to commands and launching your bot.


### `Context` Class

The `ctx` object in examples is a `Context` instance, holding update, bot information, and API methods.


## Production

### Webhooks

```typescript
import { Telegraf } from "telegraf";
import { message } from 'telegraf/filters';

const bot = new Telegraf(token);

bot.on(message("text"), ctx => ctx.reply("Hello"));

// Start webhook (preferred method)
bot.launch({
  webhook: {
    domain: "your-domain.com",
    port: 8080,
    hookPath: "/bot",
    secretToken: "your-secret-token",
  },
});
```

### Error Handling

Telegraf calls `bot.handleError` on errors.  Overwrite this with `bot.catch` for custom handling.

## Advanced Topics

- **Working with files**:  Supports file IDs, paths, URLs, buffers, and read streams.
- **Middleware**:  Each middleware receives `next()`, allowing chaining and custom logic.
- **TypeScript**: Telegraf is fully typed, with `Context` customization for custom types via generics.
- **Production deployment**:  See example integrations with various platforms (AWS Lambda, etc.).
